sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_1:
Consider the graphs G and H given below. Determine whether they are isomorphic or not.

Graph G: 

```
    a --- b
   /|\    |
  / | \   |
 h  g  \  |
  \ |   \ |
   \|    \|
    c --- d
```

Graph H:

```
    1 --- 2
   /|\    |
  / | \   |
 7  6  \  |
  \ |   \ |
   \|    \|
    3 --- 4
``` 

Are the graphs G and H isomorphic? If yes, provide an isomorphism, otherwise explain why they are not isomorphic.
message_2:
Yes, the graphs G and H are isomorphic. An isomorphism between the two graphs can be established by mapping the vertices of graph G to the vertices of graph H as follows:

a -> 1
b -> 2
c -> 3
d -> 4
g -> 6
h -> 7

This mapping preserves the adjacency of vertices, as the edges in graph G correspond to the edges in graph H:

ab -> 12
ac -> 13
ah -> 17
ag -> 16
bc -> 24
cd -> 34
cg -> 36

Thus, the graphs G and H are isomorphic.
